workflow_steps.action: Initialize global context
workflow_steps.details: Create main.md file to store global project context and roadmap in repository folder

workflow_steps.action: Create branch for approach
workflow_steps.details: When agent decides on a strategy (e.g., Playwright script), create branch folder with commit.md, log.md, and metadata files

workflow_steps.action: Log conversation history
workflow_steps.details: Automatically save all conversation messages, observations, and actions to log.md file in branch folder

workflow_steps.action: Commit milestones
workflow_steps.details: When agent completes subtasks, update commit.md with summary and optionally revise main.md

workflow_steps.action: Create alternative branches
workflow_steps.details: If approach fails, create new branch (e.g., API-based) to explore alternative strategy without losing context

workflow_steps.action: Merge completed work
workflow_steps.details: Merge commit.md into main.md, combine log.md files, and update main.md with high-level summary

workflow_steps.action: Progressive retrieval
workflow_steps.details: Agent can fetch main.md for overview, then dive into specific branch folders for detailed context

workflow_steps.action: Share across agents
workflow_steps.details: Memory files persist across different coding agent sessions (Claude Code, Cursor) and can be accessed via Slack/Telegram

workflows.overview: A memory management framework for AI coding agents that uses a Git-like structure to persist context across sessions. The system maintains hierarchical memory files (main.md, branch folders, commit.md, log.md, metadata) that allow agents to remember previous work, explore alternative approaches, and accumulate knowledge over time, improving performance by 13% on software engineering tasks.
workflows.cost_estimate: $0/month (open source framework) + standard LLM API costs
when_to_use: Long-running complex coding projects that exceed context window limits
Multi-session development work where agents need to remember previous attempts
Team environments where knowledge needs to accumulate across different agent sessions
Projects requiring exploration of multiple alternative approaches
When using smaller/cheaper models that need context augmentation to match frontier model performance
when_not_to_use: Simple one-off coding tasks that fit within standard context windows
Projects where setup overhead exceeds benefit
When working with agents that don't support custom memory frameworks
Rapid prototyping where memory persistence isn't critical
alternatives: Claude Code's built-in memory.md feature (project-specific only)
RAG-based context retrieval systems
Manual context management through detailed prompts
Vector database solutions for semantic memory search
Session-based context compression techniques

workflows.source_title: 3 years into the AI Agency model. Where it’s all going…

workflow_steps.action: Create and queue GitHub issues for features needed
workflow_steps.details: Issues represent specific features or functionality to be built

workflow_steps.action: Planning agent analyzes requirements and creates implementation plan
workflow_steps.details: Agent breaks down the feature into actionable development tasks

workflow_steps.action: Building agent writes code based on the plan
workflow_steps.details: Generates actual code implementation for the feature

workflow_steps.action: Testing agent runs automated tests on the code
workflow_steps.details: Validates functionality and catches bugs

workflow_steps.action: Reviewing agent performs code review
workflow_steps.details: Checks code quality, standards, and best practices

workflow_steps.action: Documentation agent creates technical documentation
workflow_steps.details: Generates docs for the implemented features

workflow_steps.action: System ships completed features to production
workflow_steps.details: Automated deployment of tested and reviewed code

workflow_steps.action: Human reviews completed work and tests in production
workflow_steps.details: Final validation and feedback collection for iteration

workflows.overview: An end-to-end automated engineering system that uses multiple AI agents (planning, building, testing, reviewing, documentation) to autonomously develop software features. The system processes GitHub issues overnight, ships code to production, and operates at approximately $5 per issue resolved, dramatically reducing software development costs and time.
workflows.cost_estimate: $5 per GitHub issue/feature + infrastructure costs (estimated $100-500/month for hosting and API calls)
when_to_use: Building custom internal tools or MVPs for clients
Rapid prototyping and iteration on software features
Reducing software development costs by 90%+
Scaling development capacity without hiring more engineers
Creating economically viable software that was previously too expensive
when_not_to_use: Mission-critical systems requiring extensive human oversight
Highly regulated industries with strict compliance requirements
Projects requiring deep domain expertise that AI agents lack
When you need guaranteed delivery timelines for complex features
alternatives: Traditional software development with human engineers
Low-code/no-code platforms for simpler applications
Hybrid approach with AI-assisted development but human oversight at each step
Off-the-shelf SaaS solutions instead of custom development

workflows.source_title: Claude Code + Trigger.dev: I'm Never Building Agents the Same Way

workflow_steps.action: User adds company name as task in ClickUp list
workflow_steps.details: Manual trigger - user creates task with company name

workflow_steps.action: Scheduled poller checks ClickUp every 2 minutes for new tasks
workflow_steps.details: ClickUp research poller runs on 2-minute schedule with automatic retry on failure

workflow_steps.action: When new task detected, trigger company researcher agent
workflow_steps.details: Orchestration between poller and researcher agent

workflow_steps.action: Researcher agent uses search_web tool multiple times to gather information
workflow_steps.details: Non-deterministic agent decides how many searches needed (typically 2-3 invocations)

workflow_steps.action: Agent uses read_URL tool to extract detailed information from relevant websites
workflow_steps.details: Agent autonomously selects which URLs to read based on search results

workflow_steps.action: Generate comprehensive research brief and post as comment on ClickUp task
workflow_steps.details: Includes company overview, key facts, and relevant data; marks task as complete

workflow_steps.action: Follow-up poller monitors tasks for user questions (runs every 2 minutes)
workflow_steps.details: Separate scheduled task checks for @mentions or follow-up questions

workflow_steps.action: Responder agent reads task context and answers follow-up questions
workflow_steps.details: Agent understands context from previous research and can perform additional searches if needed

workflow_steps.action: Post follow-up response as comment in ClickUp task
workflow_steps.details: Conversational agent maintains context across multiple interactions

workflows.overview: An AI agent system that monitors ClickUp tasks for company research requests, automatically researches companies using web scraping and Claude AI, posts comprehensive research briefs as comments, and can engage in follow-up conversations. Built using Claude Code for development and deployed to Trigger.dev for cloud execution with scheduled polling and automatic retries.
workflows.cost_estimate: $20-50/month for Trigger.dev + $0.10-0.50 per company research (Claude API costs) + ClickUp API free tier
when_to_use: Need automated company research for sales prospecting or competitive analysis
Want conversational AI agents that can handle follow-up questions with context
Require reliable cloud-based automation with retries and scheduling
Building custom AI workflows that need to run 24/7 without local machine
Need non-deterministic agents that make decisions about which tools to use
when_not_to_use: Simple linear automations that don't require AI decision-making (use Zapier/Make instead)
Budget is extremely limited (agent API calls add up quickly)
Don't have coding experience (requires TypeScript knowledge despite Claude Code assistance)
Need instant real-time responses (polling every 2 minutes has delay)
Working with highly sensitive data that cannot use external AI APIs
alternatives: Use Make.com or n8n with OpenAI API for simpler deterministic workflows
Build custom agents with LangChain or CrewAI and deploy to Modal or Railway
Use Relevance AI for no-code AI agent deployment with built-in tools
Implement webhooks instead of polling for real-time triggering
Use Zapier AI Actions for simpler single-step AI automations

workflows.source_title: 5 Claude Code Hacks to Build Beautiful Websites

workflow_steps.action: Create a .claud.md configuration file with system-level instructions
workflow_steps.details: Acts as a system prompt that Claude reads before every request. Include rule: 'always invoke the front-end design skill before writing any front-end code every session'

workflow_steps.action: Set up custom 'front-end design skill' in Claude Code
workflow_steps.details: Skills are custom instructions that provide specialized capabilities for specific tasks like front-end design

workflow_steps.action: Provide minimal prompt with brand assets
workflow_steps.details: Example: 'Build me a modern and professional landing page for [Brand Name]' plus brand guidelines and logo

workflow_steps.action: Claude automatically reads .claud.md file and brand assets
workflow_steps.details: System processes configuration and context before generating code

workflow_steps.action: Front-end design skill is invoked automatically
workflow_steps.details: Generates complete landing page structure with nav, hero, features, stats, etc.

workflow_steps.action: Review generated website with brand-consistent design
workflow_steps.details: Output includes matching colors, typography, logo integration, animations, and complete one-page layout

workflows.overview: A development workflow using Claude Code with custom configuration files (.claud.md) and skills to automate front-end website design and development. The system uses a custom 'front-end design skill' that is automatically invoked before any front-end code generation, creating complete landing pages with brand-consistent design from minimal prompts.
workflows.cost_estimate: $20/month for Claude Pro subscription (includes Claude Code access)
when_to_use: Building landing pages or websites quickly with consistent branding
Prototyping front-end designs without extensive manual coding
Creating brand-consistent web interfaces from minimal specifications
Automating repetitive front-end development tasks with custom rules
when_not_to_use: Complex web applications requiring extensive backend integration
Projects requiring pixel-perfect design control
When you need full control over every design decision
Production applications without human review and refinement
alternatives: Using traditional front-end frameworks with component libraries
Hiring a web designer/developer
Using website builders like Webflow or Framer
Using other AI coding assistants like GitHub Copilot or Cursor with custom prompts

workflows.source_title: Building Beautiful Websites with Claude Code Is Too Easy

workflow_steps.action: Install Visual Studio Code and Claude Code extension
workflow_steps.details: Download VS Code, install the Claude Code extension from the extensions marketplace, and authenticate with Anthropic Pro or Max subscription

workflow_steps.action: Create and open a project folder
workflow_steps.details: Create a new folder on your desktop or documents for the website project and open it in VS Code

workflow_steps.action: Add claw.md configuration file
workflow_steps.details: Create or download a claw.md file that acts as a system prompt, instructing Claude Code to always invoke the front-end design skill before writing front-end code

workflow_steps.action: Install front-end design skill
workflow_steps.details: Run commands to install the front-end design skill globally, which helps Claude generate modern, professional designs instead of basic AI-generated layouts

workflow_steps.action: Create brand_assets folder with logo and guidelines
workflow_steps.details: Add a folder containing brand assets like logos, color palettes, typography guidelines, and icons for Claude to reference

workflow_steps.action: Prompt Claude Code to build the website
workflow_steps.details: Give a simple prompt like 'build me a modern and professional landing page for [company name]' and Claude will reference the claw.md, skills, and brand assets to generate code

workflow_steps.action: Iterate and refine the design
workflow_steps.details: Review the generated website, provide feedback, and update the claw.md file as needed throughout the project

workflows.overview: A workflow for building professional, branded websites using Claude Code (Anthropic's AI coding agent) within Visual Studio Code. The process uses a custom claw.md configuration file, front-end design skills, and brand assets to generate modern landing pages and websites without traditional coding.
workflows.cost_estimate: $20/month for Claude Pro or $200/month for Claude Max subscription
when_to_use: Building landing pages or simple websites quickly without extensive coding knowledge
Creating branded web experiences when you have design assets but limited development resources
Prototyping website designs rapidly for client presentations or MVPs
Generating modern, professional-looking websites with animations and dynamic elements
when_not_to_use: Building complex web applications with extensive backend logic and database integrations
Projects requiring highly custom functionality that AI agents struggle to implement
When you need pixel-perfect designs that match exact specifications
Production applications requiring extensive testing and security audits
alternatives: Traditional web development with frameworks like React, Vue, or Next.js
No-code website builders like Webflow, Framer, or Wix
Hiring a professional web developer or agency
Using other AI coding assistants like GitHub Copilot or Cursor IDE

workflows.source_title: I Built a Safer OpenClaw Alternative Using Claude Code

workflow_steps.action: Analyze OpenClaw's core features and architecture
workflow_steps.details: Study the open-source repository to understand what makes it feel magical - persistent memory, context awareness, and personalization

workflow_steps.action: Design custom agent architecture with security controls
workflow_steps.details: Create a more controlled version that addresses security concerns while maintaining core functionality

workflow_steps.action: Implement memory and context management system
workflow_steps.details: Build system to track user preferences, work context, and conversation history over time

workflow_steps.action: Integrate Claude API for AI capabilities
workflow_steps.details: Use Claude as the underlying LLM for natural language understanding and generation

workflow_steps.action: Develop custom agent logic and controls
workflow_steps.details: Write approximately 2000+ lines of Python code and markdown to replicate OpenClaw functionality with better security

workflows.overview: A custom-built personal AI assistant alternative to OpenClaw that maintains memory of user preferences and work context over time. Built using Python and Claude API with enhanced security controls compared to the open-source OpenClaw project.
workflows.cost_estimate: $20-100/month for Claude API usage depending on interaction volume
when_to_use: When you need a personalized AI assistant with memory and context awareness
When security and control over your AI agent is a priority
When you want to customize assistant behavior to your specific needs
When you have Python development skills and want full ownership of the solution
when_not_to_use: If you lack Python programming experience
If you need a quick plug-and-play solution without customization
If you're comfortable with OpenClaw's security model and don't need custom features
If you don't want to maintain custom code
alternatives: Use OpenClaw directly if security concerns are acceptable
Use commercial AI assistant platforms like ChatGPT Plus with custom instructions
Build with no-code agent builders like Relevance AI or VoiceFlow
Use LangChain or CrewAI frameworks for faster agent development

workflows.source_title: How to Properly Use Claude Code Agent Teams (FULL LIVE BUILD)

workflow_steps.action: Planning phase with Claude Code
workflow_steps.details: Interactive planning session where Claude asks clarifying questions to understand requirements for payment integration feature

workflow_steps.action: Create structured implementation plan
workflow_steps.details: Generate detailed plan covering database schema changes, authentication, frontend billing page, and backend token consumption logic

workflow_steps.action: Spawn agent team with task distribution
workflow_steps.details: Main agent spawns multiple teammate agents that share a task list and can communicate directly with each other without going through main agent

workflow_steps.action: Parallel development across stack layers
workflow_steps.details: Agents work simultaneously on database schema (adding transactions and tokens), frontend (billing page), backend (token consumption), and authentication (Supabase integration)

workflow_steps.action: Integrate Chargebee payment processing
workflow_steps.details: Use Chargebee skill/integration in Claude Code to implement payment processing without hallucinations due to training cutoff

workflow_steps.action: Agent coordination and task completion
workflow_steps.details: Agents autonomously coordinate who handles which tasks, communicate progress, and knock off completed items from shared task list

workflow_steps.action: End-to-end browser automation testing
workflow_steps.details: Automated testing of the complete payment flow from token purchase through consumption in chat interactions

workflows.overview: A development workflow using Claude Code's Agent Teams feature to build a complete payment integration into an existing agentic chat application. Multiple AI agents work in parallel on frontend, backend, and database changes while autonomously communicating with each other to coordinate tasks, implementing token-based billing where users purchase tokens to interact with the chat agent.
workflows.cost_estimate: High token usage - estimated $50-200+ per complex feature build due to multiple agents running simultaneously with communication overhead
when_to_use: Building complex features that span multiple layers of the stack (frontend, backend, database)
When you need parallel development on independent but coordinated tasks
Production-grade feature implementation that requires touching multiple parts of codebase simultaneously
When speed of development is more important than token cost optimization
when_not_to_use: Simple single-file or single-layer changes where sub-agents would suffice
When you need highly deterministic, predictable behavior
Budget-constrained projects where token costs are a primary concern
Current state (as of video): Not ready for production-grade software due to non-deterministic behavior and reliability issues
alternatives: Traditional sub-agents approach where main agent coordinates but agents don't communicate peer-to-peer
Sequential development with single Claude Code agent
Cursor IDE with similar agentic capabilities
Manual development with AI assistance for specific tasks rather than full autonomous teams

workflow_steps.action: Set up virtual machine environment for OpenClaw deployment
workflow_steps.details: Create multiple computer instances (up to 5+ shown) to run parallel OpenClaw agents. Alternative platforms mentioned: Manis, Kimmy, or local Mac Mini

workflow_steps.action: Initialize OpenClaw in terminal using TUI interface
workflow_steps.details: Launch OpenClaw terminal interface on each virtual machine instance to create dedicated AI agents

workflow_steps.action: Configure primary OpenClaw agent to spawn sub-agents
workflow_steps.details: One main OpenClaw instance can spawn up to 8 sub-agents, each with its own dedicated computer/VM for parallel task execution

workflow_steps.action: Deploy sub-agents to find automation opportunities
workflow_steps.details: Configure sub-agents to search Upwork for AI automation job postings ranging from $500-$20,000+ that match OpenClaw capabilities

workflow_steps.action: Automate specific business workflow - product data extraction
workflow_steps.details: Example: Agent looks up products for promotional distributorship, downloads product information and reports, parses data

workflow_steps.action: Integrate extracted data into business systems
workflow_steps.details: OpenClaw uploads parsed product information into Zoho CRM to create centralized source of truth for client

workflow_steps.action: Monitor multiple agent instances from single dashboard
workflow_steps.details: View all running OpenClaw instances, their tasks, and status in one unified interface

workflows.overview: Deploy multiple OpenClaw AI agent instances in virtual environments to automate business tasks like data extraction, CRM updates, and lead generation. The workflow demonstrates using OpenClaw to spawn sub-agents that can autonomously find opportunities on Upwork, scrape product data, and populate CRM systems while running 24/7.
workflows.cost_estimate: $50-200/month for VM hosting (Orgo or alternatives) + OpenAI API costs ($20-100/month depending on usage) + potential Upwork fees (10-20% of project value)
when_to_use: When you need to scale automation services across multiple clients simultaneously
For finding and bidding on automation opportunities on freelance platforms
When business workflows require end-to-end automation including web scraping, data processing, and CRM integration
For busy executives needing multiple parallel automation tasks running 24/7
When offering 'AI automation as a service' to businesses
when_not_to_use: For simple single-task automations that don't require AI reasoning
When you need guaranteed deterministic outcomes (AI agents can be unpredictable)
If you're just starting with automation and need to learn basics first
When tasks require human judgment for compliance or sensitive decisions
alternatives: Traditional RPA tools (UiPath, Automation Anywhere) for more deterministic workflows
No-code platforms (Make.com, Zapier) for simpler integrations without AI reasoning
Custom Python scripts with Selenium for web automation without AI overhead
Hiring virtual assistants for tasks requiring consistent human judgment

workflows.source_title: Claude Code built me a $273/Day online directory

workflow_steps.action: Identify directory niche and data sources
workflow_steps.details: Research profitable directory niches (funeral homes, senior living, gas prices, etc.) that have strong lead generation or advertising potential

workflow_steps.action: Use Claude Code to build directory structure
workflow_steps.details: Prompt Claude Code to generate the website architecture, database schema, and frontend interface for the directory

workflow_steps.action: Data collection and enrichment
workflow_steps.details: Use Claude Code to scrape, aggregate, and enrich data from various sources. This is described as the hardest and most valuable part of the process

workflow_steps.action: Data cleaning and validation
workflow_steps.details: Clean and validate collected data to ensure quality and accuracy for the directory listings

workflow_steps.action: Deploy directory website
workflow_steps.details: Deploy the directory on WordPress or similar platform to generate organic traffic on autopilot

workflow_steps.action: Implement monetization strategy
workflow_steps.details: Set up lead generation forms, advertising integrations, or develop complementary vertical SaaS products

workflows.overview: This workflow uses Claude Code (Anthropic's AI coding assistant) to build automated online directories that generate passive income through organic traffic. The process emphasizes data collection, enrichment, and cleaning to create valuable directory websites that monetize through lead generation, advertising, or vertical SaaS products.
workflows.cost_estimate: $200-1000 initial investment + $20-50/month hosting + Claude API costs
when_to_use: Building passive income businesses with limited capital ($200-1000)
Creating data-driven websites that generate organic traffic
Establishing a traffic base before building SaaS products
Entering markets with strong lead generation potential (senior living, funeral homes, local services)
Building vertical SaaS businesses with built-in customer acquisition
when_not_to_use: When you need immediate revenue (directories take time to build traffic)
In highly saturated directory markets without unique data angles
When you cannot access or legally scrape quality data sources
If you lack patience for SEO and organic growth strategies
alternatives: Manual directory building with no-code tools like Webflow or Bubble
Using existing directory templates and plugins for WordPress
Building directories with traditional web development instead of AI coding
Purchasing existing directories and improving them
Using specialized directory builders like Brilliant Directories

workflows.source_title: You Need to Hear This Update...

workflow_steps.action: Set up dedicated hardware environment
workflow_steps.details: Purchase and configure a Mac Mini as dedicated machine for OpenClaw to operate independently

workflow_steps.action: Install and configure OpenClaw
workflow_steps.details: Open-source installation with full system permissions, browser access, and tool integrations

workflow_steps.action: Connect AI model API
workflow_steps.details: Configure Claude Opus API access for the agent's reasoning and decision-making capabilities

workflow_steps.action: Grant access to work tools
workflow_steps.details: Provide agent with access to Notion, email, Google Docs, and other necessary work tools

workflow_steps.action: Define research tasks and parameters
workflow_steps.details: Set up repetitive research processes that previously required human workers

workflow_steps.action: Enable remote access and monitoring
workflow_steps.details: Configure remote control to monitor agent operations from different locations

workflow_steps.action: Review completed work outputs
workflow_steps.details: Check results of autonomous research and task completion without needing to intervene during execution

workflows.overview: OpenClaw is an open-source AI agent that operates autonomously with full computer access to complete end-to-end tasks without human intervention. The creator uses it for research work that previously required human employees, running it remotely on a dedicated Mac Mini with significant API costs ($300/day mentioned).
workflows.cost_estimate: $300/day in Claude Opus API credits + $600-800 one-time for Mac Mini hardware
when_to_use: Repetitive research tasks that require multi-step reasoning and tool use
End-to-end workflows that previously required dedicated human workers
Tasks requiring browser automation, document creation, and cross-platform coordination
When you have technical expertise to troubleshoot and configure complex systems
When API costs are justified by labor replacement value
when_not_to_use: If you need secure, production-grade systems (explicitly not secure)
If you lack technical expertise for troubleshooting and configuration
For simple automation tasks better handled by traditional tools like Zapier or Make
When you cannot afford high API costs ($300+/day mentioned)
If you need intuitive, plug-and-play solutions without steep learning curves
For tasks requiring human judgment, creativity, or emotional intelligence
alternatives: Traditional automation platforms (Make.com, Zapier) for simpler, more reliable workflows
AI coding assistants (Cursor, GitHub Copilot) for development tasks
Specialized AI tools for specific use cases rather than general-purpose agents
Human virtual assistants for tasks requiring judgment and reliability
Hybrid approach: AI for prototyping/assistance + human for execution

workflows.source_title: Vibe Coding Explained for Beginners - Build Apps with AI

workflow_steps.action: Access vibe coding platform and choose starting method
workflow_steps.details: Can start with blank slate, upload screenshot for design reference, or use planning mode for AI-assisted planning

workflow_steps.action: Craft initial prompt describing the app requirements
workflow_steps.details: Optional: Use LLM to brainstorm and refine prompt before submitting. Include features like user authentication, workflow stages, and AI integrations

workflow_steps.action: Submit prompt to generate initial app version
workflow_steps.details: Platform automatically creates implementation plan including features, flow, design language, and components

workflow_steps.action: Review generated app with dashboard, pipeline view, and idea management pages
workflow_steps.details: App includes authentication, multi-page navigation, mobile optimization, and workflow stages (idea to research to production to publishing)

workflow_steps.action: Refine app using follow-up prompts
workflow_steps.details: Make iterative improvements to design, functionality, and features using natural language refinement prompts

workflow_steps.action: Add AI-powered features like idea generation and script writing
workflow_steps.details: Integrate AI capabilities directly into the app for content creation assistance

workflow_steps.action: Test mobile responsiveness and publish app
workflow_steps.details: Review mobile view and deploy for team use with individual user accounts

workflows.overview: A vibe coding workflow that uses natural language prompts to build a custom YouTube content management system without traditional coding. The system manages the entire video production pipeline from ideation through publishing, with user authentication and AI-powered script generation capabilities.
workflows.cost_estimate: Base 44 subscription (pricing varies by plan) + potential AI API costs for integrated features
when_to_use: Need custom internal tools but lack coding expertise
Managing complex content production workflows across teams
Want rapid prototyping of business applications
Existing tools don't match your specific workflow needs
Need multi-user apps with authentication and role management
when_not_to_use: Require highly specialized or complex backend logic
Need deep integration with legacy enterprise systems
Building apps that require real-time performance at scale
Security requirements exceed no-code platform capabilities
alternatives: Use existing project management tools like Notion, Asana, or Monday.com
Hire developer to build custom solution
Combine no-code tools like Airtable with automation platforms like Make.com or Zapier
Use other vibe coding platforms like Replit, Cursor, or v0.dev
